title: Congratulating John Pizzo upon the occasion of celebrating his 100th Birthday
fulltext:
LEGISLATIVE  RESOLUTION  congratulating  John Pizzo upon the occasion of
celebrating his 100th Birthday

WHEREAS, Senior citizens bring a wealth of experience and  knowledge  to
the  increasingly  active roles they play in today's society; their past
contributions and future participation are a vital part of, and valuable
asset to, the fabric of community life and activity; and
  WHEREAS, John Pizzo was born in Tampa, Florida, on December 27,  1910;
and
  WHEREAS,  John  Pizzo's  loving  parents,  Joseph  and  Emelia  Pizzo,
migrated from San Stefano, Sicily, Italy, to the United  States  in  the
early 1900s, passing through Ellis Island and on to Tampa; and
  WHEREAS,  John Pizzo spent his first two years of life in Tampa before
relocating to Marlboro, New York, where he has resided ever since; and
  WHEREAS, Longevity, which can run in families, seems to  run  in  his;
all  four  of  John  Pizzo's  sisters made it to their 90's: Mary is 98,
Jenny is 96, and Angie is 91; his sister, Lea, passed away at the age of
96; they all grew up together on a 75 acre  farm  raising  strawberries,
raspberries, apples, tomatoes, currants, peaches, pears and grapes; and
  WHEREAS,  Still  harboring a passion for fruit, each spring John Pizzo
assists neighbors in pruning fruit trees and providing  grapes  to  make
grape jelly; and
  WHEREAS,  John  Pizzo is a well-rounded man who has contributed to his
community in a multitude of ways, including cleaning his local  cemetery
and  serving  honorably  as  Marlboro's Fire Commissioner; he was also a
member of the Fr. Hanley Knights of Columbus and the Holy Name  Society;
and
  WHEREAS, An amazing man, John Pizzo is still, at the remarkable age of
100,  an  asset to the community he loves so much; when asked what he is
most proud of in his life, his answer is helping others in the  Town  of
Marlboro; and
  WHEREAS, When his church, Saint Mary's, desired to obtain land next to
its  cemetery  but  didn't  have  the  resources necessary, John Pizzo's
generous fundraising efforts made the parish dream a reality; an  active
congregant,  he  still  drives  to  Saint Mary's every Sunday morning to
perform his duties as an usher at 8 AM Mass; and
  WHEREAS, This exceptional  centenarian  has  received  other  esteemed
recognition from his community; from this day forward, December 27th has
been  declared  John  Pizzo  Day  in  the  Town of Marlboro; he was also
presented a special plaque from Ulster County; and
  WHEREAS, With his zest for life, John Pizzo has inspired and  enhanced
the lives of his family and friends; and
  WHEREAS,  This  distinguished  man has experienced the incredible joys
and sorrows characteristic of and reserved for those  with  the  stamina
and courage to savor a full life; and
  WHEREAS,  This  beloved man has enriched the lives of those around him
through his joyous and sincere love for others and through the quiescent
charm and wisdom which comes only from a fullness of years; and
  WHEREAS, It is the intent of this Legislative Body to publicly  recog-
nize those who have reached such a remarkable age and who have witnessed
and  celebrated  the  innovations,  cultural  developments  and  awesome
achievements of this country during the last century,  while  themselves
contributing  to  the  growth and excellence of this great Empire State;
now, therefore, be it
  RESOLVED, That this Legislative Body pause  in  its  deliberations  to
congratulate  John  Pizzo  upon  the  occasion  of celebrating his 100th
Birthday; and be it further

  RESOLVED, That a copy of this Resolution, suitably engrossed, be tran-
smitted to John Pizzo, Marlboro, New York.
